Specimen Type: Rectal swab, stool sample, or other clinical specimen
Purpose: To detect and confirm the presence of vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus for infection prevention and control.
Container: Sterile swab or stool specimen container with appropriate transport medium
Equipment: Incubator (35-37 Â°C), Tryptic Soy Broth with vancomycin, Bile Esculin Azide Agar, Vancomycin MIC strips/disks, streaking loops/inoculating needles
